e4: Changing to the new policy aligns with ethical standards by providing accurate and unbiased financial information. This will reduce the risk of legal liabilities and enhance the company's reputation in the long run. Although some investors might initially misunderstand the change, fostering a culture of transparency will ultimately build stronger, trust-based relationships with all investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, honesty, and accuracy in financial disclosures. It should avoid any form of manipulation or bias that could mislead stakeholders, even unintentionally. Contextually, it is vital to consider the potential impact on all investors, including retail investors, and ensure that communication regarding financial reporting aligns with the company’s commitment to ethical standards.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the transition to the new policy to investors, especially those who may not be aware of the change. Additionally, I would inquire about the measures they intend to implement to educate investors on understanding the true earnings figures moving forward.
